intro: Juppia, commonly known as the African violet, is a popular flowering plant native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the Gesneriaceae family and is characterized by its velvety, dark green leaves and showy, tubular flowers. The plant typically grows as a compact shrub, often reaching heights of 10 to 30 centimeters. It thrives in warm, humid environments and requires well-draining soil to prevent root rot. Juppia is widely cultivated as a houseplant due to its ornamental value and ease of care.
